Threat-model the described feature. Assume a malicious user with time and motivation.

Instructions
- Identify assets to protect (data, credentials, money, availability, reputation).
- Define actors and capabilities (anonymous user, authenticated user, insider, compromised client).
- Map entry points and trust boundaries.
- Enumerate likely threats (abuse cases, injection, authz bypass, data exfiltration, DoS).
- Propose mitigations and detection (validation, authz checks, rate limits, logging, alerting).

Output
- A concise threat model: assets, entry points, threats, mitigations, and residual risk.
